00001 #include "Lgm/Lgm_MagModelInfo.h"
00002 #include "Lgm/Lgm_LstarInfo.h"

00006 /*
00007  *   FindShellLine
00008  *   -------------
00009  *  
00010  *   Find the field line that has the given I and Bm values at the specified MLT.
00011  *   On return
00012  *
00013  *      Inputs:
00014  *
00015  *          I0   - the value of the integral invariant for the desired drift shell
00016  *            Bm   - the value of the mirror field for the desired drift shell 
00017  *            MLT  - magnetic local time meridian in which to search for shell field line.
00018  *            mlat - an initial guess for the magnetic latitude of the mirror pointat which 
00019  *
00020  *      Outputs:
00021  *
00022  *            mlat - the magnetic latitude of the mirror point (at which B=Bm)
00023  *            rad  - the geocentric radial distance of the mirror point (at which B=Bm)
00024  *        
00025  *
00026  *      Return Value:
00027  *
00028  *            1 - normal exit. Field line found with acceptable accuracy.
00029  *            0 - no field line could be found
00030  *
00031  *      Influential Parameters:
00032  *
00033  *            List here - 
00034  *
00035  */
00036 int FindShellLine( double I0, double *Ifound, double Bm, double MLT, double *mlat, double *rad, double mlat0, double mlat1, Lgm_LstarInfo *LstarInfo ) {
00037 
00038 
00039     Lgm_Vector    u, w, Pm_North;
00040     double        a, b, c, d, D, I, r, Phi, cl, sl, SS, mlat_min=0.0, Dmin;
00041     int            done, FoundValidI;
00042 
00043 
00044     /*
00045      *   Set the bracket for the mlat range. The safest values here would be 0->90 deg.
00046      *   since if a shell field line exists for the given I,Bm values, it must have Bm
00047      *   between 0 and 90. (Is this strictly true for very low L-shells that involve FLs
00048      *   near the equator?)
00049      *
00050      *   A problem with using 0->90 is that long FLs take some time to integrate. The
00051      *   search algorithm moves away from these FLs in a few steps, but those steps cost 
00052      *   us alot.
00053      *
00054      *   A compromise I have adopted here is to allow the user to set the bracket manually. 
00055      *   Be careful because there *will* be problems if the bracket is no good (i.e. its not 
00056      *   a true bracket).
00057      *   
00058      */
00059     a = mlat0;
00060     c = mlat1;
00061     Dmin = 9e99;
00062     done = FALSE; FoundValidI = FALSE;
00063     while ( !done ) {
00064 
00065 
00066         d = c-a;        // range of bracket
00067 //        b = a + 0.5*d;    // pick new mlat point halfway through range 
00068         b = a + 0.6*d;    // pick new mlat point halfway through range 
00069 
00070 //printf("a, b, c = %g %g %g\n", a, b, c );
00071 
00072         /*
00073          *  For this MLT/mlat value, find the radius at which
00074          *  B = Bm. We assume MLT/mlat is defined relative to 
00075          *  SM coords. All of my tracing routines assume GSM,
00076          *  so convert to GSM.
00077          */
00078 
00079 //printf("Bm, MLT, b, r = %g %g %g %g\n", Bm, MLT, b, r );
00080         if ( !FindBmRadius( Bm, MLT, b, &r, LstarInfo->mInfo->Lgm_FindBmRadius_Tol, LstarInfo ) ) {
00081 
00082             /* 
00083              *  Couldnt get a valid Bm. (The bracket is pretty huge,so
00084              *  we probably ought to believe there really isnt a valid one.)
00085              */
00086             printf("%sNo Bm found: setting I to 9e99%s\n", LstarInfo->PreStr, LstarInfo->PostStr);
00087             I = 9e99;
00088     
00089         } else {
00090 
00091             /*
00092              *  We found a (candidate) mirror point.
00093              *  Compute its GSM coords.
00094              */
00095             Phi = 15.0*(MLT-12.0)*RadPerDeg;
00096 //printf("b = %.15lf\n", b);
00097             cl = cos( b * RadPerDeg ); sl = sin( b * RadPerDeg );
00098             w.x = r*cl*cos(Phi); w.y = r*cl*sin(Phi); w.z = r*sl;
00099             Lgm_Convert_Coords( &w, &u, SM_TO_GSM, LstarInfo->mInfo->c );
00100             if (LstarInfo->VerbosityLevel > 4) {
00101                 printf("%sResults of FindBmRadius: Bm, MLT, mlat, r = %g %g %g %g%s\n", LstarInfo->PreStr, Bm, MLT, b, r, LstarInfo->PostStr);
00102                 printf("%sResults of FindBmRadius: u_sm  = %g %g %g%s\n", LstarInfo->PreStr, w.x, w.y, w.z, LstarInfo->PostStr);
00103                 printf("%sResults of FindBmRadius: u_gsm = %g %g %g%s\n", LstarInfo->PreStr, u.x, u.y, u.z, LstarInfo->PostStr);
00104             }
00105 
00106             
00107             /*
00108              *  This point is the northern mirror point.
00109              */
00110             LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_North = u;
00111 
00112 
00113 
00114             /*
00115              *  Compute I
00116              *
00117              *     Compute I for the field line that goes through this point.
00118              *     Before we do the integral, we need to locate the mirror points.
00119              *     We only have to find the southern mirror point, because we have
00120              *     the northern one already.
00121              *
00122              *     Trace from Pm_North to Pm_South
00123              */
00124              I = 9e99;
00125              //LstarInfo->mInfo->Hmax = 10.0;
00126              //LstarInfo->mInfo->Hmax = 0.1;
00127              LstarInfo->mInfo->Hmax = 0.1;
00128              if ( Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint( &(LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_North), &(LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_South), &SS, 120.0, LstarInfo->mInfo->Bm, -1.0, LstarInfo->mInfo->Lgm_TraceToMirrorPoint_Tol, LstarInfo->mInfo ) > 0 ) {
00129 
00130 //printf("LstarInfo->mInfo->Bm = %g\n", LstarInfo->mInfo->Bm);
00131 //Lgm_Vector Bcrap;
00132 //double BBBB;
00133 //LstarInfo->mInfo->Bfield( &LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_North, &Bcrap, LstarInfo->mInfo );
00134 //BBBB=Lgm_Magnitude( &Bcrap );
00135 //printf("LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_North = %g %g %g   B = %g\n", LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_North.x, LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_North.y, LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_North.z, BBBB);
00136 //LstarInfo->mInfo->Bfield( &LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_South, &Bcrap, LstarInfo->mInfo );
00137 //BBBB=Lgm_Magnitude( &Bcrap );
00138 //printf("LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_South = %g %g %g   B = %g\n", LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_South.x, LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_South.y, LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_South.z, BBBB);
00139 //
00140 //FILE *fpcrap;
00141 //int iiii;
00142 //if ((MLT>20.0)&&(MLT<23.0)){
00143 //fpcrap = fopen("TraceLine2.dat", "a");
00145 //Lgm_Convert_Coords( &(LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_North), &w, GSM_TO_SM, LstarInfo->mInfo->c );
00146 //fprintf(fpcrap, "%g %g\n", w.x, w.y );
00147 //fclose(fpcrap);
00148 //}
00149 
00150 //LstarInfo->mInfo->UseInterpRoutines=FALSE;
00151                 if ( LstarInfo->mInfo->UseInterpRoutines ) {
00152 
00153                     /*
00154                      *  Do interped I integral. For this to work, we need to trace out the FL with TraceLine().
00155                      *  This is additional overhead to start with, but it may be faster in the end.
00156                      *
00157                      *  Note we start at Pm_South and trace to Pm_North (which is at an altitude of (r-1.0) Re above the Earth.
00158                      */
00159                     // 1.0 is way too big -- this was causing errors for the lower PAs
00160                     //LstarInfo->mInfo->Hmax = (I0 > 5.0 ) ? 1.0 : 0.1;
00161 //                    LstarInfo->mInfo->Hmax = 0.1;
00162                     LstarInfo->mInfo->Hmax = 0.01;
00163 //LstarInfo->mInfo->Hmax = 0.5;
00164 LstarInfo->mInfo->Hmax = SS/200.0;
00165 
00166 
00167 
00168 
00169                     // Do not include Bmin here (second to last arg must be FALSE). We dont have a proper Bmin here.
00170 
00171 //printf("Pm_South, Pm_North = %g %g %g    %g %g %g\n", LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_South.x, LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_South.y, LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_South.z, Pm_North.x, Pm_North.y, Pm_North.z );
00172                     Lgm_TraceLine2( &(LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_South), &Pm_North, (r-1.0)*Re, 0.5*SS-LstarInfo->mInfo->Hmax, 1.0, 1e-7, FALSE, LstarInfo->mInfo );
00173 
00174 //printf("LstarInfo->mInfo->nPnts = %d    LstarInfo->mInfo->Hmax = %g\n", LstarInfo->mInfo->nPnts, LstarInfo->mInfo->Hmax );
00175 //if ((MLT>20.0)&&(MLT<23.0)){
00176 //fpcrap = fopen("TraceLine2.dat", "a");
00177 //for (iiii=0; iiii<LstarInfo->mInfo->nPnts; ++iiii){
00178 //fprintf(fpcrap, "%g %g\n", LstarInfo->mInfo->Px[iiii], LstarInfo->mInfo->Pz[iiii]);
00179 //}
00180 //fprintf(fpcrap, "%g %g\n", LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_North.x, LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_North.y);
00181 //fprintf(fpcrap, "%g %g\n", Pm_North.x, Pm_North.y);
00182 //fclose(fpcrap);
00183 //}
00184 
00185 
00186                     /*
00187                      *  Set the limits of integration. 
00188                      */
00189                     LstarInfo->mInfo->Sm_South = 0.0;
00190                     LstarInfo->mInfo->Sm_North = SS;
00191 
00192                     /*
00193                      *  Add the mirror points explicity. Update: Actually the
00194                      *  first should already be there so dont include it.
00195                      */
00196                     //AddNewPoint( 0.0, LstarInfo->mInfo->Bm, &LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_South, LstarInfo->mInfo );
00197                     ReplaceFirstPoint( 0.0, LstarInfo->mInfo->Bm, &LstarInfo->mInfo->Pm_South, LstarInfo->mInfo );
00198                     AddNewPoint( SS,  LstarInfo->mInfo->Bm, &Pm_North, LstarInfo->mInfo );
00199 //int ij;
00200 //
00201 //printf("Bm: %.15lf\n", LstarInfo->mInfo->Bm );
00202 //for (ij=0; ij<LstarInfo->mInfo->nPnts; ++ij){
00203 //printf("Interp Array: %.15lf %.15lf\n", LstarInfo->mInfo->s[ij], LstarInfo->mInfo->Bmag[ij] );
00204 //}
00205 //printf("Bm: %.15lf\n", LstarInfo->mInfo->Bm );
00206 
00207 
00208 
00209 
00210 
00211                     InitSpline( LstarInfo->mInfo );
00212 
00213                     /*
00214                      *  Do I integral with interped integrand. 
00215                      */
00216                     I = Iinv_interped( LstarInfo->mInfo  );
00217                     if (LstarInfo->VerbosityLevel > 1) printf("\t\t%s  Integral Invariant, I (interped):      %15.8g    I-I0:    %15.8g    mlat:   %12.8lf  (nCalls = %d)%s\n",  LstarInfo->PreStr, I, I-I0, b, LstarInfo->mInfo->Lgm_n_I_integrand_Calls, LstarInfo->PostStr );
00218 
00219                     FreeSpline( LstarInfo->mInfo );
00220 
00221                 } else {
00222 
00223                     /*
00224                      *  Set the limits of integration. Also set tolerances for
00225                      *  Quadpack routines.
00226                      */
00227                     LstarInfo->mInfo->Sm_South = 0.0;
00228                     LstarInfo->mInfo->Sm_North = SS;
00229 
00230                     /*
00231                      *  Do full blown I integral. 
00232                      */
00233                     I = Iinv( LstarInfo->mInfo  );
00234                     if (LstarInfo->VerbosityLevel > 1) printf("\t\t%s  Integral Invariant, I (full integral): %15.8g    I-I0:    %15.8g    mlat:   %12.8lf  (nCalls = %d)%s\n",  LstarInfo->PreStr, I, I-I0, b, LstarInfo->mInfo->Lgm_n_I_integrand_Calls, LstarInfo->PostStr );
00235 
00236                 }
00237 
00238 
00239             } else {
00240 
00241                 /* 
00242                  * open field line 
00243                  */
00244                 if (LstarInfo->VerbosityLevel > 2) printf("%sOpen Field line: setting I to 9e99%s\n", LstarInfo->PreStr, LstarInfo->PostStr );
00245 
00246              }
00247 
00248 
00249         }
00250 
00251 
00252 
00253 
00254 
00255 
00256 
00257 
00258 
00259 
00260 
00261 
00262 
00263         /*
00264          *  Compute difference between I and the desired I (i.e. I0 that the caller gave us)
00265          */
00266         D = I-I0;
00267 
00268         /*
00269          *  Hold on to closest value
00270          */
00271         if (fabs(D) < Dmin){
00272             Dmin = fabs(D);
00273             mlat_min = b;
00274         }
00275         
00276         
00277 
00278         if ( fabs( D ) < LstarInfo->mInfo->Lgm_FindShellLine_I_Tol ) {
00279             /* converged */
00280             done = TRUE;
00281             FoundValidI = TRUE;
00282 //            *mlat = 0.5*(a+c);  // Take average of endpoints as final answer
00283             *mlat = mlat_min;
00284         } else if ( fabs(b-mlat0)  < 1e-5 ) {
00285             /* converged  to lower endpoint -- no valid mlat found within interval - probably have
00286              * to enlarge initial bracket.
00287              */
00288             done = TRUE;
00289             FoundValidI = -2;
00290         //} else if ( fabs(b-mlat1) < 1e-5 ) {
00291         } else if ( fabs(b-mlat1) < 1e-8 ) {
00292             /* converged  to upper endpoint -- no valid mlat found within interval - probably have
00293              * to enlarge initial bracket.
00294              */
00295             done = TRUE;
00296             FoundValidI = -3;
00297         } else if ( fabs(a-c) < 1e-8 ) {
00298             /* converged  to something, but not I?
00299              * try to enlarge initial bracket.
00300              */
00301             done = TRUE;
00302             if ( fabs(D) < 0.1 ) {
00303                 FoundValidI = TRUE; // lets just take what we get here....
00304                 *mlat = mlat_min;  // Use the best value we got
00305             } else {
00306                 FoundValidI = -4;
00307             }
00308 FoundValidI = -4;
00309         } else if ( D > 0.0 ) {
00310             c = b;
00311         } else {
00312             a = b;
00313         }
00314 
00315     }
00316 //printf("FoundValidI = %d\n", FoundValidI);
00317 
00318 
00319 
00320 
00321     *rad    = r;
00322     *Ifound = I;
00323 
00324 
00325     return( FoundValidI );
00326 
00327 
00328 
00329 }

00333 
00334 
00335 /*
00336  *  This routine is used in the above routine. For the given MLT and mlat, it locates the vertical
00337  *  radius where the field strength is equal to the specified mirror field strength, Bm. It assumes
00338  *  that r will be between 120km (altitude) and 20Re (geocentric).
00339  *  
00340  *  Need to add error handling for cases where we cant find a radius. This could happen if the actual
00341  *  radius lies outside of the assumed bracket. E.g., could drop below 120km.
00342  *
00343  */
00344 int FindBmRadius( double Bm, double MLT, double mlat, double *r, double tol, Lgm_LstarInfo *LstarInfo ) {
00345 
00346     Lgm_Vector    u, v, Bvec;
00347     int            done, FoundValidBm;
00348     double        Phi, D, a0, c0, Da0, Dc0;
00349     double        a, b, c, d, B, cl, sl, cp, sp, lat, f, g;
00350 
00351 
00352     Phi = 15.0*(MLT-12.0)*RadPerDeg; lat = mlat * RadPerDeg;
00353     cl = cos( lat ); sl = sin( lat );
00354     cp = cos( Phi ); sp = sin( Phi );
00355     f = cl*cp; g = cl*sp;
00356 
00357 
00358     /*
00359      *  Get bracket on r. 
00360      *  Originally, I thought we could just set this bracket straight away
00361      *  without actually do a search.  But it would appear that this is not the
00362      *  case. Lets search for it in 0.5 Re increments. Assume a0, but lets step
00363      *  out to find c0.
00364      */
00365     a0 = 1.0 + 120.0/Re;      // 110 km altitude
00366 
00367     u.x = a0*f; u.y = a0*g; u.z = a0*sl;
00368     Lgm_Convert_Coords( &u, &v, SM_TO_GSM, LstarInfo->mInfo->c );
00369     LstarInfo->mInfo->Bfield( &v, &Bvec, LstarInfo->mInfo );
00370     B = Lgm_Magnitude( &Bvec );
00371     Da0 = B - Bm;
00372 
00373     //c0 = 20.0;                // this ought to be big enough!?
00374     //c0 = 15.0;                // this ought to be big enough!?
00375     c0 = a0;
00376     done = FALSE;
00377     while ( !done ) {
00378 
00379         // Increment c0 and recompute Dc0.
00380         c0 += 0.1;
00381         u.x = c0*f; u.y = c0*g; u.z = c0*sl;
00382         Lgm_Convert_Coords( &u, &v, SM_TO_GSM, LstarInfo->mInfo->c );
00383         LstarInfo->mInfo->Bfield( &v, &Bvec, LstarInfo->mInfo );
00384         B = Lgm_Magnitude( &Bvec );
00385         Dc0 = B - Bm;
00386 
00387         // Check to see if we went beyond Bm
00388         if ( Dc0 < 0.0 ) {
00389             done = TRUE;
00390         }
00391 
00392 //printf("c0 = %g     B = %g    Bm = %g\n", c0, B, Bm);
00393         // We may never be able to get a B value low enough...
00394         if (c0>20.0) return(FALSE);
00395     }
00396 
00397 
00398 
00399 
00400     if (LstarInfo->VerbosityLevel > 5) {
00401         printf( "%sFindBmRadius: a0, c0 = %g %g   Da0, Dc0 = %g %g%s\n", LstarInfo->PreStr, a0, c0, Da0, Dc0, LstarInfo->PostStr  );
00402     }
00403 
00404 
00405     /*
00406      *  For the search to work, Da0 (B-Bm at a0) must be positive to start with.
00407      *  If it isnt it means the value of Bm we are looking for is below the lowest
00408      *  point we are willing to allow (i.e. its in the loss cone). Also, (for whatever
00409      *  reason) if Dc0 is > 0.0 we wont be able to find the point because its higher than our
00410      *  initial c0.
00411      */
00412 
00413     if ( ( Da0 < 0.0 ) || ( Dc0 > 0.0 ) ) return( FALSE );
00414 
00415 
00416 
00417 
00418     /*
00419      *  Find a bracket by stepping out in small increments.
00420      */
00421     done = FALSE;
00422     b    = a0;
00423     while ( !done ) {
00424 
00425         u.x = b*f; u.y = b*g; u.z = b*sl;
00426         Lgm_Convert_Coords( &u, &v, SM_TO_GSM, LstarInfo->mInfo->c );
00427         LstarInfo->mInfo->Bfield( &v, &Bvec, LstarInfo->mInfo );
00428         B = Lgm_Magnitude( &Bvec );
00429         D = B - Bm;
00430 
00431         if ( D < 0.0 ) {
00432             done = TRUE;
00433             a0 = b - 0.1;
00434             c0 = b + 0.1;
00435             break;
00436         } else {
00437             b += 0.1;
00438         }
00439 
00440     }
00441     if (LstarInfo->VerbosityLevel > 5) {
00442         printf("%sFindBmRadius: a0, c0 = %g %g%s\n", LstarInfo->PreStr, a0, c0, LstarInfo->PostStr );
00443     }
00444     
00445 
00446     a = a0, c = c0;
00447 
00448     done = FALSE;
00449     FoundValidBm = FALSE;
00450     while ( !done ) {
00451 
00452         d = c-a;
00453         b = a + 0.5*d;
00454 
00455 
00456         u.x = b*f; u.y = b*g; u.z = b*sl;
00457         Lgm_Convert_Coords( &u, &v, SM_TO_GSM, LstarInfo->mInfo->c );
00458         LstarInfo->mInfo->Bfield( &v, &Bvec, LstarInfo->mInfo );
00459         B = Lgm_Magnitude( &Bvec );
00460         D = B - Bm;
00461 
00462 
00463         if ( (fabs((b-a0)/a0) < tol) || (fabs((b-c0)/c0) < tol) ) {
00464             /* converged to an endpoint -> no Bm in interval! */
00465             done = TRUE;
00466             FoundValidBm = FALSE;
00467         } else if ( fabs(D/Bm) < tol ) {
00468             /* converged */
00469             done = TRUE;
00470             FoundValidBm = TRUE;
00471         } else if ( fabs(d) < tol ) {
00472         done = TRUE;
00473         printf("%sFindBmRadius: Warning, BmRadius converged before Bm (might not have found proper Bm)%s\n", LstarInfo->PreStr, LstarInfo->PostStr );
00474         FoundValidBm = TRUE; // not really true 
00475         } else if ( D > 0.0 ){
00476             a = b;
00477         } else {
00478             c = b;
00479         }
00480 
00481         if (LstarInfo->VerbosityLevel > 5) {
00482             printf("%sFindBmRadius: a, b, c = %g %g %g    D, Bm, fabs(D/Bm) = %g %g %g%s\n", LstarInfo->PreStr, a, b, c, D, Bm, fabs(D/Bm), LstarInfo->PostStr );
00483         }
00484 
00485     }
00486 
00487 
00488 
00489     /*
00490      *  Take average of endpoints as final answer
00491      */
00492     *r = 0.5*(a+c);
00493     if (LstarInfo->VerbosityLevel > 5) {
00494         printf("%sFindBmRadius: Final r = %.15lf%s\n", LstarInfo->PreStr, *r, LstarInfo->PostStr );
00495     }
00496     return( FoundValidBm );
00497 
00498 }
00499

00501
